sen.j: 大中臣 定長（おおなかとみ の さだなが、生年不詳 - 康治元年12月9日 (旧暦)（1142年12月27日））は、平安時代後期の歌人。
sen.e: ONAKATOMI no Sadanaga (date of birth unknown - December 27, 1142) was a kajin (a waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poet) who lived in the latter part of the Heian period.
ONAKATOMI no Sadanaga (date of birth unknown - December 27, 1142) was a kajin (a waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poet) who lived in the latter part of the Heian period.
ONAKATOMI no Sadanaga (date of birth unknown - January 3, 1143) was a waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poet who lived in the latter part of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正、「歌人」の表記を修正

sen.j: 大中臣定登の子で、叔父（父の末弟）の従二位祭主大中臣公長の養子となった。
sen.e: He was a son of ONAKATOMI no Sadanobu and was adopted as a son of ONAKATOMI no Kinnaga who was his uncle (the youngest brother of his father) and Junii saishu (Junior Second Rank, chief priest).
sen.cmt: 大中臣定登 - 読み不明
sen.e: He was a son of ONAKATOMI no Sadanobu and was adopted as a son of ONAKATOMI no Kinnaga who was his uncle (the youngest brother of his father) and Junii saishu (Junior Second Rank, chief priest).

He was a son of ONAKATOMI no Sadanobu (大中臣定登) and was adopted as a son of ONAKATOMI no Kinnaga who was his uncle (the youngest brother of his father) and Junii saishu (Junior Second Rank, chief priest).
sen.cmt: 大中臣定登→読み不明のため、"ONAKATOMI no Sadanobu (大中臣定登)"としました。

sen.j: 子に大中臣清長がいた。
sen.e: His son was ONAKATOMI no Kiyonaga.
His son was ONAKATOMI no Kiyonaga.
His son was ONAKATOMI no Kiyonaga.

sen.j: 保延4年（1138年）、養父公長が殺人の罪に問われて職務を停止されたため、定長も連座して神事供奉を停止された。
sen.e: Since his adopted father Kiminaga was stopped duties because of an accusation of murder in 1138, Sadanaga was implicated in it and was stopped shinji gubu (to be in attendance on divine services).

Since his adopted father Kiminaga was stopped from his duties because of an accusation of murder in 1138, Sadanaga was implicated in it and was stopped from shinji gubu (to be in attendance on divine services).

Since his adopted father Kinnaga was stopped from his duties because of an accusation of murder in 1138, Sadanaga was implicated in it and was stopped from shinji gubu (to be in attendance on divine services).

sen.j: その後、神祇官（神祇官の次官）に転任し、康治元年12月9日卒去した。
sen.e: After that, he was transferred to Jingikan (department of worship) as vise-minister of Jingikan and died on January 3, 1143.
After that, he was transferred to Jingikan (department of worship) as vice-minister of Jingikan and died on January 3, 1143.
After that, he was transferred to the Gon no taifu (vice-minister of Jingikan, department of worship) and died on January 3, 1143.
sen.cmt: 「神祇官（神祇官の次官）」→意味が通じないためウェブ上で確認したところ、「権大副（神祇官の次官）」となっており、リンク先の単語が表示されているようです。ウェブ上の表記に基づき訳文を修正しました。

sen.j: 詠歌が『金葉和歌集』に1首収録されている（歌番号672）。
